Reviews.Title: “AVOID The worst hotel I have stayed at bar none AVOID”
Reviews.Author: DrEigen
Reviews.Content: Toilet had a huge whole in it, had to reach into tank to flush. BLOOD on walls, shower was filled with mold, staff was the rudest I ever encountered. They were very mad at us when we checked in because we came around 11pm which must have been past the man's bedtime. When we complained about the room issues all were rude and the one woman Veronica is the winner. She called my wife and her sister racial slurs (they are Asian) when they complained, the least rude of which is that they all look alike when I asked her which one she talked to. I however (Caucasian) did not receive this treatment but was still told repeatedly that they would fix the issues and they never did. The four person room was abysmal, with a tiny molded couch for the two extra people. The pictures on the site are misleading, there is no lobby for this hotel it is across the street. I ended up paying about 140 euro/night to stay at this hell hole, go somewhere nicer. AVOID AVOID AVOID

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
Reviews.Author: Ashley T
Reviews.Content: We were on a budget but wanted to have the experience of living in Venice close to canals and within walking distance of St Mark's Square. After a lot of research I found this hotel...so glad I did! All we wanted were quiet comfortable clean warm rooms (we came in February) with plenty of hot water and a good shower...and that is exactly what we got. And I loved all the riotous red and gold decor and the soft padded walls! The receptionists at the Bel Arti hotel were friendly and helpful and even though there are no receptionists in The Domus, we felt looked after and very quickly called it "home". And breakfast was very nice. We had a great holiday here and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Switch from Domus Cavanis to Hotel Belle Arti without extra charges”
Reviews.Author: Naomisan_HU
Reviews.Content: We have booked and paid a non-refundable double room at Domus Cavanis via AGODA. But since it was a high season (between Christmas and New Year time), the Domus Cavanis Hotel* must have been overbooked, so we got a room in its sister hotel, at Hotel Belle Arti*** without any extra payment or charge. (Please note when you book a hotel, the price does not include the local tourist tax, which has to be paid upon arrival.) The reception of Hotel Belle Arti, at which you have to do your check-in (also for the Domus Cavanis), pretends to be super busy. The staff do not provide tourist information in extended level, they only do their minimum. Until you do not start asking questions, they are nice. If you want to keep this kind attitude of theirs, I advise you not force receiving answer to your touristic questions... :) If you need plus info about dining or POIs, buy a book or look for a tourist info center. The breakfast for Domus Cavanis Hotel is also arranged at the Hotel Belle Arti, which we found to be very good. It is true that the type of food is the same every morning (ham, cheese, bread, cakes, yoghurt, muesli, coffee, tea, juices, etc.) but the sortiment and the volume is enough and their quality is perfect. The location of Domus Cavanis and Hotel Belle Arti is simply excellent. The best way to find them is with vaporetto (eg. #1), which stops at Academia. You only have to get off, turn left and almost immediately right and after an appr. 1 min. walk on a flat street, you arrive to the check-in desk. (We've seen sooo many people struggling with their huge luggages on wheels throught the steps and bridges in the inner city.) The location is good also for visiting the city. San Marco Square and all main tourist attractions are close (in appr. 5-10 min. walk distance). The price of the Domus Cavanis Hotel is unbeatable in Venice. So in general I highly recommend this hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: patkosvero
Reviews.Content: Domus Cavanis it's a normal place, nothing special but it's OK. It has everything you need: perfect location, cleanliness, good heating, hot water, nice breakfast, silence (if you don't have too noisy neighbours). But nothing more, for example you have to make the check-in and breakfast in an other hotel, near the place, in Domus Cavanis you can't find any member of the staff. A simple place to stay, but if you aren't too exigent, and you are a low-budget traveller, it's perfect, we liked it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terrible Room”
Reviews.Author: SherrieARC
Reviews.Content: If you want to spend about $200 American dollars (which is cheap in Venice.. so I now know) and don't mind a teeny-tiny bathroom/shower... the flattest pillows I have ever seen and no air conditioning, the location is terrific. I will admit that the only reason I booked here is because all the other reasonably priced (less than $300) per night hotels were full. The location is great, and the room was clean. I would have been much more tolerant of the whole situation if the air conditioning had worked. I even had them come check it - and because the fan was blowing - they insisted it was working, even though it was 85 degrees in the room. The bed was soft enough, but the pillows were flat and old and the blanket was so itchy we had to throw it on the floor (not like we needed it anyway.) Apparently the breakfast was included - but they did not tell us that, and I was so mad in the morning we left.

Reviews.Title: “Probably best Value for Money in Venice; staying in Dorsoduro is an Experience on its Own”
Reviews.Author: brandeis2012
Reviews.Content: I would highly, highly recommend Domus Cavanis for anyone looking for budget yet comfortable accommodations in Venice. It is a 1-star 'pensione', but it's facilities and amenities might as well be 3-star. The lobby, breakfast (delicious and with unlimited espressos, yum!) and rest area are actually at another (3-star) hotel, the Belle Arti--which is 10 steps in front of Domus Cavanis. The rooms were impeccably clean, quite large, and quiet at night. Many had a view to a nice internal courtyard of some other building. The hotel itself is well-located in the Venetian area of Dorsoduro and is about a 30-second walk from the Accademia and Accademia Bridge, a 5-min walk from the Peggy Guggenheim, 10-min walk from St. Mark's and the Doge's Palace, and a 15-20 min walk from the Rialto bridge and the Jewish Ghetto. But hey, it's Venice, and part of the fun is walking through its back-alleys and narrow, winding streets! Do yourself a favor, stay away from the tourists jam-packing other areas of Venice, and come for a genuinely Venetian experience at the Domus Cavanis in Dorsoduro. In the afternoons you can see local students pouring out of their schools and universities, and you can see Italian grannies taking their grandchildren for a stroll.

Reviews.Title: “torturous experience”
Reviews.Author: raoarchie
Reviews.Content: the hotel is one of the most pathetic ones I have come across. we booked a quadruple room with clear instructions on 4 beds not bunks yet they gave us child sized bunk beds. Husband and myself travlling with our 60+ aged parents and it was a nightmare. This hotel single handedly ruined mine and my parents experience of venice. at 1130 pm we had to check in when we realized about the bunk beds, all they said was "sorry" without meaning it. we somehow spent the night even though we were extremely exhauted from travel. the next morning when we complained to the manager, he and receptionist both were very rude and they tried to give us discount on the room in a very demeaning manner as though we were complaining for a discount. they were downright racist. wouldnt recommend at all if you want to have anything close to a pleasant experience in venice.

Reviews.Title: “not at all worth the money”
Reviews.Author: spikekahn
Reviews.Content: there must be better hotels in venice than this one. although the location is wonderful, even at $110/night, the room itself was not very nice. I agree that the reception staff treated us like the step-children of the larger hotel, giving us the run around when we had a complaint, taking three days just to talk to someone in charge, and even then, never did get to the manager - "come talk to the mngr in the morning", next day, 10 am: "oh, the mngr left, you must come EARLY in the morning", then next day, 7 am: "oh, it's the weekend, the mngr isn't around and it's too early to call him". the first room, a grand and VERY CLEAN red wall papered room, overlooked the back street. A/C didn't even move the air. Tried to call the front desk, but the phone didn't work. It was late, so went to bed, and then heard a huge pop and the lights went out. fell asleep, and suddenly was woken with the lights flashing on at 3 am. when i complained, the office clerk said that it must have been because i used the hair dryer and caused the power outage (i have very short hair and do not use a hair dryer). then they agreed to move us to another room, but said, the a/c is on a central system, so they didn't think another room would be different. this is in italy in july, with temperatures at 98*F/29*C. it was cooler outside. got to another room by asking the cleaning woman (give her a medal, she cleaned spotlessly) which is the coolest room around. that room was 1/2 the size, but cooler and overlooked a lightwell, which if you craned your neck, you could see that there was a garden (for other rooms' view.) that worked out ok, even though every time anyone in the building used the bathroom, the water ran down noisily in the pipe outside our window. by the third day, there was a rainstorm and must have been too much water for the pipes to handle, because from then on, the room smelled of sewage if we opened the windows. by then it seemed pointless to complain, so we didn't bother, as we doubted any other room would be better. finally, after the third day of trying to talk to someone, i asked for a discount on the rooms, and got 50% off for the first night. I would never go here again. there must be a better place to stay in venice for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: jessybobs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Domus Cavanis in March, for the price i payed ( 40 euro per night) it was excellent value for Venice, and would certainly stay again. I arrived early at the Belle Arte for check in and my room was not ready, so sat in the lovely garden area of the Belle Arte, i got talking to a couple who had demanded to be moved from the Domus Cavanis as their room was absolutely freezing. I was feeling a bit wary, I knew it was basic, after all you get what you pay for. Well when it was time for check in I was a bit apprehensive of what I would find, true there is a reception and bar that is not manned and the stairwell seemed a little derelict. I was on the 2nd floor, ( lift still not working) I was pleasantly surprised, the room was huge, and lovely and warm ( was very cold in Venice) spotlessly clean, 70's looking furniture, and a bed settee. I was over looking the courtyard at the back so very quiet. The bathroom was a good size and very clean, and also warm in there too. There was a connecting door and to my surprise another suite of rooms,even larger, with another double bed and another bathroom, so I was very impressed, the 2nd bathroom came in very handy. Breakfast and staff over at the Belle Arte were very pleasant. no compaints, apart from the coffee, for Italy it was terrible. And its true about the lady in charge of the coffee machine, she likes to keep it to herself ... plenty of cereal, meat, cheese, salami, cakes and yoghurt. Croissants are limited I think as 2 are placed on your table, and no more in sight, I did ask where they were and I was brought another. Overall enjoyed my stay at a very very reasonable price, and would recommend and stay there again, perfect location near to Accadamia and Zattere vap stops, very easy to find from both stops, for Accadamia take the 1st left Via Antonio Foscarini, form Zattere , the Gesu church is on the corner. We ate at Nobili both nights and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “merely a place to live”
Reviews.Author: smth_snail
Reviews.Content: cons: * rooms in this hotel vary dramatically in sizes. unfortunately the one that we stayed in was incredibly small: besides furniture and bathroom there is about 4 sq meters extra in total. * the thermostats in my room doesn't work, and we were frozen one night (with A/C on) and sweating the other night (with A/C off). * one dude at the reception was extremely rude while the others were okay. * wifi costs several bucks per hour and is only available in the lobby. pros: * breakfast is good given the price we paid * good location

Reviews.Title: “A good deal”
Reviews.Author: sbdarla
Reviews.Content: The best part of Domus Cavanis is the location. It's so close to the vaperetto stop, bridge, and museums and tons of other sights and restaurants. The only part that bothered me was the front desk situation because even though the front desk at the larger hotel (same owners) across the street was very helpful and had 24 hr. reception, it was a little scary at times walking through the dimly lit, empty lobby area at the hotel. Other than that, the room was clean and as said before, the location was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a family of 4 or 5”
Reviews.Author: FamilyLlama
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 had shared some very small rooms in other cities. This was a HUGE room with a big bed plus a crazy couch that made out into a triple bunk bed. There was nothing fancy about the building, but we couldn't get over how much space we had. It was clean and had air conditioning. I was thrilled by the price, location and space. We ate breakfast with people paying WAY more in the main hotel. Breakfast was more elaborate than what you usually get in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Hellish nightmare”
Reviews.Author: i_hate_venice
Reviews.Content: can not stress enough how much i hated the place from start to finish!! the staff in reception were very very very rude!!very unhelpfull, ignorant , snotty!!! on the net the hotel advertises a Bar, true they do have a bar displaying what drinks you could have if they would open the bar!! but you guessed it they dont open the bar! as for overlooking a pretty gargen!! bull!the garden is the same as the rest of venice, run down and shabby!! pots with dead plants in them and a dirty table and chairs set flung in the corner!! breakfast was horrible, consisted of small rock hard bread rolls cheap ham , cheese and salami, staff again were horrible and rude!the ceral was indiscribable and the fruit salad was a joke!! rooms were clean enough and must say the housekeeping staff were very pleasent!! (should move them to front of house) all i can say is dont go!! i know it is cheap but a smile is free , except in venice where they woukld prob charge 3.50 for the pleasure!! if you already havent booked your trip to venice! Dont! cannot stress how horrilbe it is!! yopu may imagine it to be beautifuly and romantic but the reality is very very different! the whole city is run down and covered in graffitti!!the water is dirty! you have to pay for the pleasure of even entering a church! the dodges palace is a joke!! you will be terriosied by birds constantly!! the shopping in none existant!! shopping centres off the island are crap!! everything was crap!! and a special note for anyone wanting to go in JANUARY...... DONT most places are closed until feb! and anyone wanting to have a laugh and a few drinks, DONT GO!! impossible to find a pub and most places shut down at around 8 or nine and the you have to spend the rest of the night stitting in your crap room watching the italian shopping network because the satalite TV they advertise consists of the same five channels over and over again!! for the sake of your sanity dont go!!!

Reviews.Title: “The poor cousin of the Hotel Belle Arte over the lane”
Reviews.Author: sandboy
Reviews.Content: and unfortunately that how the staff treat you. This building is separate from the Belle Arte and the rooms are pretty sparse, but do overlook a nice venetian court yard. Breakfast was pretty ordinary (and I'd had a few European breakfasts by the time I got to Venice) - my view is somewhat coloured by missing baggage and being sick. In all seriousness though, for the prices you pay in Venice this was very clean and pretty good value for money and if I was going back to venice I'd stay there again, except that I would like to try a different part of the city. To quote the Lonely Planet guidebook - few places are as breathtakingly beautiful, or as teeth grindingly frustrating as venice. STAY AWAY DURING SUMMER the place is swarming with tourists (like me) if I go back to venice it will be off season.

Reviews.Title: “Not top notch, but good location”
Reviews.Author: oregongirl2005
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as part of a tour in May 2006. It is located across the way from the Hotel Belle Arti (this is where you check in and have breakfast) in the Dorsoduro neighborhood. During my stay, the Domus was not attended by any in-building staff, even though there was a reception area, giving the place an eerie, deserted feel. The rooms were very plain and the amenities not super great (horrible shower) - sort of like a Motel 6 in the states. Breakfast was adequate but not stellar. On the plus side, the hotel is in a great location, just steps from two vaporetto stops (Zattere and Accademia). Given the high price of hotels in Venice, the location outweighs the cons.

HotelInfo.Name: Domus Cavanis
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 896, 30123 Venice, Italy
